identificationModule.briefTitle: LOWER: Lomitapide Observational Worldwide Evaluation Registry
identificationModule.officialTitle: LOWER: Lomitapide Observational Worldwide Evaluation Registry

descriptionModule.briefSummary: This global product exposure registry is a multicentre, long-term, prospective, observational cohort study (exposure registry), designed to evaluate the long term safety and effectiveness of lomitapide.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription: To evaluate the occurrence of adverse events of special interest, long term effectiveness of lomitapide, and to evaluate whether prescribers of lomitapide are following screening and monitoring recommendations as specified in product labeling.

primaryOutcomes.description: to evaluate the occurrence of hepatic abnormalities
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: patients will be followed for 10 years

secondaryOutcomes.description: to evaluate the occurrence of GI events
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: patients will be followed for 10 years

secondaryOutcomes.description: to evaluate any occurrence of tumors (small bowel, hepatic, colorectal or pancreatic)
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: patients will be followed for 10 years

secondaryOutcomes.description: to evaluate the occurrence of events associated with coagulopathy (abnormal bleeding, cerebral haemorrhage or GI bleeding)
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: patients will be followed for 10 years

secondaryOutcomes.description: to evaluate the occurrence of MACE events
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: patients will be followed for 10 years

secondaryOutcomes.description: to evaluate the occurrence and cause of death
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: patients will be followed for 10 years

secondaryOutcomes.description: to evaluate the occurrence and outcomes of pregnancy in females of reproductive potential treated with lomitapide. Patients who become pregnant will be offered enrolment into a separate Pregnancy Exposure Registry (PER).
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: patients will be followed for 10 years

secondaryOutcomes.description: to evaluate the long-term effectiveness of lomitapide in maintaining control of serum lipid levels in a clinical practice setting.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: patients will be followed for 10 years

secondaryOutcomes.description: to evaluate whether prescribers of lomitapide enrolled at registry sites are following the screening and monitoring recommendations as specified in the PI and the prescriber educational materials aimed at risk minimization.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: patients will be followed for 10 years

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Patients of all ages, including minors, who have initiated commercial treatment with lomitapide prior to or at time of registry enrolment.
* Patients who have the ability to understand the requirements of the study and provide written informed consent to comply with the study data collection procedures or paediatric patients with the consent of a parent or legal guardian.

Patients ≥7 years of age (or above the age determined by the IRB/EC and in accordance with the local regulations and requirements) must also provide written informed assent forms.

Exclusion Criteria:

* Patients who are receiving lomitapide in clinical trials or through compassionate use, where patients are followed under a separate protocol.
* Patients receiving an investigational agent, defined as any drug or biologic agent other than lomitapide that has not received market authorization in the country of participation, at time of lomitapide initiation and continuing to receive an investigational agent at time of registry enrolment. These patients may be enrolled if receiving lomitapide when the investigational agent is discontinued..
eligibilityModule.studyPopulation: Patients treated with lomitapide who agree to participate in the study.
